title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create a TypeScript interface called `Book` with the following properties:
1. `title` (string, required)
2. `author` (string, required)
3. `pages` (number, required)
4. `isbn` (string, optional)
5. `isRead` (boolean, required)

Then create two book objects using this interface:
- A book you've read (with all properties including isbn)
- A book you haven't read yet (without isbn)

Log both books to verify they work.
instructions:
Create a TypeScript interface called `Book` with the following properties:
1. `title` (string, required)
2. `author` (string, required)
3. `pages` (number, required)
4. `isbn` (string, optional)
5. `isRead` (boolean, required)

Then create two book objects using this interface:
- A book you've read (with all properties including isbn)
- A book you haven't read yet (without isbn)

Log both books to verify they work.

testCases.description: Should create book objects with interface

hints.text: Use `?` to make isbn optional. The syntax is: `propertyName?: type`

commonMistakes.consequence: TypeScript errors when you omit required properties from an object.
commonMistakes.correction: Include all required properties; only properties with ? are optional.

commonMistakes.consequence: Property names are case-sensitive; userName is not the same as username.
commonMistakes.correction: Match property names exactly as defined in the interface.
